origin.identifier: https://asset-resources.gdevelop.io/public-resources/Xelu Free Controller and Key Prompts/Console Inputs/PS Move/e5930ec08353d859245617a72651216fd06f0c256e3772fcafc6bc0ce8d53917_Triangle.png
origin.name: Triangle.png

objects.name: Alerts
objects.string: Thank you... I am at peace.

children.value: In an undisclosed location, a new client has set up a meeting with you to discuss your role as a Mender.
You will explain your procedure and if accepted, enter the client's mind and cleanse it of any disruptions.
So, do you understand that the procedure can be considered invasive to some? I'll have direct access to emotions and memories that could be private.
I understand. I just want to feel at peace.
In that case, let us begin.

events.comment: Mirror player image depending on direction of movement
Move the camera to center on the mender (you have to do this for every layer that you want to move)
When player enters the region for puzzle 1, if puzzle 1 is not solved already, start puzzle 1

parameters: "A disruption. Press e to attempt to resolve it."

events.comment: When player enters the region for puzzle 2, if puzzle 2 is not solved already, start puzzle 2

parameters: "Another disruption? This one looks... different. Press e to attempt to resolve it."
"A disruption.... this must be the last one. Press e to attempt to resolve it. "
"An object of reference! This must have been Jack's first phone. A lot's changed since then.."

events.comment: Mirror player image depending on direction of movement
Move the camera to center on the mender (you have to do this for every layer that you want to move)
When player enters trigger for canvas, play help text

parameters: "Looks like a canvas of emotion. You'll need to organize the scattered emotions and states of mind. Press e to pick up and place a shard and x to drop it."
"A shard of emotion! This looks like a pendant with a tear. Sadness?"
"A shard of emotion! This looks like a family portrait. Love or Connection?"
"A shard of emotion! A sunflower, it could represent a blooming personal growth."
"A shard of emotion! A book? A journal? This could indicate a time of self reflection."
"It's done! The scattered emotions have been organized correctly and the disruption has been resolved."

events.comment: Mirror player image depending on direction of movement
Move the camera to center on the mender (you have to do this for every layer that you want to move)
When player enters trigger for canvas, play help text

parameters: "A maze... a recurring nightmare for Jack. Find your way out without triggering anything."
"You're stuck and can't breathe! Dissipate the gas with space."
"You made it out, but your speed is slightly impacted."
"You're about to enter a narrow passage! Don't touch the walls.... or restart."
"You made it! Jack can sleep peacefully now. The disruption has been resolved."

events.comment: Mirror player image depending on direction of movement
Move the camera to center on the mender (you have to do this for every layer that you want to move)

parameters: "Jack is fighting against your mending! Survive for 20 seconds."

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: FireBullet
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Fire bullets, manage ammo, reloading and overheating.
description: This extension allows objects to fire bullets.
- Firing multiple bullets at a time ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://fire-bullet))
A simple example shows how to make firing patterns ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://firing-patterns)).

eventsBasedBehaviors.name: FireBullet

Subtract 1 from ammo (if not unlimited ammo)
Only reload the amount of ammo available

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ShakeObject
description: Shake an object (position, angle or scale).
- Object slowly rocking back and forth (like a ship)
- Simulate engine vibration, earthquake, or pulsing
The top-down RPG example uses this extension for damage animations ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://top-down-rpg)).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description:
Shake an object, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle).
This behavior can be used on any type of object.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: ShakeObject_PositionAngle

eventsFunctions.description: Shake an object, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle). Make sure to "Stop shaking" before starting a new shake if it uses different parameters.
eventsFunctions.name: ShakeObject_PositionAngle
eventsFunctions.sentence: Shake object _PARAM0_ for _PARAM2_ seconds. Modify position amplitude _PARAM3_ on X axis and _PARAM4_ on Y axis, angle rotation amplitude _PARAM5_.  Wait _PARAM6_ seconds between shakes. Keep shaking until stopped: _PARAM7_

events.comment: Pass input parameters to global variables so that onScenePostEvents can use them
Determine if the shake should keep going until stopped
Add default values if none were provided
If duration is less than a single shake, increase duration to make 1 full shake

parameters.description: Amplitude of postion shake in X direction (in pixels)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerX

parameters.description: Amplitude of position shake in Y direction (in pixels)  (For example: 5)
parameters.longDescription: Use a negative number to make the single-shake move in the opposite direction.
parameters.name: PowerY

parameters.description: Amplitude of angle rotation shake (in degrees)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerAngle

parameters.description: Amount of time between shakes (in seconds) (Default: 0.08)
parameters.longDescription: For a single-shake effect, set it to the same value as "Duration".
parameters.name: TimeBetweenShakes

events.comment: Run once before every shake movement

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct any drift from previous shake
Make initial shake NOT random so users can set a direction for a one-shake effect
After initial shake pick a random direction
Save that initial shake has been processed
Calculate the fraction of shake that occured during this frame
Increase change for the first half of the shake (move away from original values)
Decrease change the second half of the shake (return to original position)
Stop shaking when the duration has been reached (or if the stop shaking function was called)

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct any drift from previous shake

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct any drift from previous shake
Make initial shake NOT random so users can set a direction for a one-shake effect
After initial shake pick a random direction
Calculate object scale displacement, with linear decay over time
Save that initial shake has been processed
Calculate the fraction of shake that occured during this frame
Increase change for the first half of the shake (move away from original values)
Decrease change the second half of the shake (return to original position)
Stop shaking when the duration has been reached (or if the stop shaking function was called)

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: DialogBox
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: This extension adds Dialog Box functionality that can be used for RPGs, visual novels, and more.
description: This extension adds Dialog Box functionality that can be used for RPGs, visual novels, and more.
1. You will need a background **sprite**, a character **sprite**, a **BBText** to display the name, a **BBText** to display the text, and a **sprite** for the icon to prompt the player for action.
1. Add the "Dialog Box" behavior to the background object.
1. Place each object in the scene.
1. Execute the "Setup Dialog Box" action only once in the event.
1. After that, execute the "Open Dialog Box" action, "Close Dialog Box" action, etc.
**Number of times the Text in Dialog Box has changed** - condition
**Number of times the Text in Dialog Box has changed** - expression
This Dialog Box has a useful counter function.
It is zero when the dialog box is opened, and increases by one each time the text changes.
(However, it will not increase until the frame advances).
This feature is useful for keeping track of the progress of a conversation.
In typing, style tags in BBText OBjects are also counted as characters.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description:
This extension adds the functionality of a dialog box to your game.
Add this to the sprite object that will be the background of the dialog box.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: westboy, daliyoucefmedakram@gmail.com, @bouh
eventsFunctionsExtensions.fullName: Auto typing animation for text ("typewriter" effect)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: AutoTyping
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Animate text to simulate it being written one character at at time (a "typewriter" effect).
description: Animate text to simulate it being written one character at at time (a "typewriter" effect), with a customizable time between each character. Useful for dialogue scenes or visual novels.
- Add the behavior to a Text object (BBText, Bitmap Text object) and choose the interval between characters.
- Change the typing speed with the "Change interval" action.
- Pause the typing and resume it at any time.
- Use the "Skip to end of text" action to give users a way to skip text they don't want to read
- If the text changes, the automatic typing starts again from the beginning with the new text.
- Use a condition to check if the typing finished.
- Use a condition to check if a new text character was added. This is useful to trigger audio effects.
- Use the "CurrentCharacter" expression to know when a specific character was displayed.
The top-down RPG example uses this extension ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://top-down-rpg)).

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: DraggablePhysics
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Drag a physics object with the mouse (or touch).
description: Enables players to click and drag on physics objects to move them.  The object retains velocity when the click is released, allowing players to fling objects across the screen.
- The default "draggable" behavior will not work on objects with the physics behavior. This extension should be used instead.
- This extension will only work on objects that have the physics behavior.
- Kinematic physics mode is incompatible with this extension. The object will be changed to dynamic mode.
The Parking Jam example uses this extension ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://parking-jam)).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Drag a physics object with the mouse (or touch).
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: DraggablePhysics

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: BehaviorRemapper
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Quickly remap Behavior controls to different keys.
description: Make sure to disable default controls unless you want two keys to do the same action.
Actions have two versions. `custom` allow the movement keys to be changed to what ever you would like. `presets` provide a common key-bindings that can be selected from a list.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: PixelPerfectMovement
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Grid-based or pixel perfect platformer and top-down movements.
description: Games with pixel art usually use pixels bigger than actual pixels of the screen. This can lead to big pixels partially overlapping each other which doesn't look good.
This extension allows to seamlessly keep big pixels aligned when the object is stopped and still beneficiate from the high resolution of the screen to have smooth movements.
* Align top-down characters on a grid ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://top-down-grid-movement))

events.comment: We don't know if the deceleration was already applied or not this step, but if the speed drifted from more than 1%, another extension is probably modifying the speed and it must not be overridden.
Find how far to go to reach a pixel.
Move to the target as the movement behavior would do.
Find how far to go to reach a pixel.
Move to the target as the movement behavior would do.

Check if the character is decelerating.
It's done in doStepPostEvent because there is no way to know if the doStepPreEvents of this behavior is executed before or after the one of PlatformerCharcter.
As TimeDelta is used, we have to be sure the last PlatformerCharcter.doStepPreEvents call used the same TimeDelta. Which means this must be done after PlatformerCharcter.doStepPreEvents.
Save the speed to detect speed changes from outside.
